testcases_summary: The tests verify role assignment and permission retrieval functionalities in a Flask app. They cover successful and failed role assignments, missing data scenarios for role assignment, invalid JSON handling, and permission retrieval with and without an email.
The tests verify the creation and validation of the Role class, including scenarios with valid and invalid data for role ID, name, and permissions, as well as boundary values.

The tests verify the creation of User instances, checking both valid and various invalid input scenarios including incorrect types for user_id, name, email, and role_id, as well as null values for name, email, and role_id.

The tests verify the creation of UserRole objects in different scenarios, including valid creation, missing user_id or role_id, duplicate entries, edge cases for zero and negative IDs, and invalid data types for user_id and role_id.
The tests verify the RoleRepository class's get_role_by_name method, checking for valid roles, invalid roles, and edge cases such as empty strings, whitespace strings, and None values.

The tests validate the UserRepository class, including finding users by email, updating user roles, handling non-existent users, empty and invalid emails, and edge cases for role IDs like zero and negative.

The tests verify the functionalities of the UserRoleRepository, including assigning roles to users, handling assignment failures, retrieving user roles, and changing user roles. They cover scenarios of success, non-existence of user roles, and database failures.
The tests verify the RoleService's ability to assign roles to users and fetch their permissions. Various scenarios are covered, including cases where the user or role is not found in the system.
